</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;" HREF="#OII_10KX12312016_HTM_S89F67D9B094FBFCD9CA6ACFB121B28B3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Demand for floating rigs is the primary leading indicator of the strength of the deepwater market. According to industry data published by IHS Petrodata, at the end of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, there were 336 floating drilling rigs in operation or available for work throughout the world, with 151 of those rigs under contract. Of the 151 rigs under contract, 91 are contracted through the end of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Recent industry forecasts of floating rig demand point to an expectation that demand in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;will decline by approximately 25%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In addition to floating rig demand, the number of subsea tree completions is another leading indicator, and the primary demand driver for our Subsea Products lines. According to industry data published by Infield Systems Limited in January 2017, there will be 200 subsea tree installations in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, down from 305 in 2016, 308 in 2015 and 349 in 2014. Subsea tree installations are forecast to increase to 227 in 2018.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We have based the following discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations on our consolidated financial statements, which we have prepared in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States. These principles require us to make various estimates, judgments and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reported amounts of revenue and expense during the periods we present. We base our estimates on historical experience, available information and other assumptions we believe to be reasonable under the circumstances. On an ongoing basis, we evaluate our estimates; however, our actual results may differ from these estimates under different assumptions or conditions. The following discussion summarizes the accounting policies we believe (1)&#160;require our management's most difficult, subjective or complex judgments and (2)&#160;are the most critical to our reporting of results of operations and financial position.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Revenue Recognition.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;We recognize our revenue according to the type of contract involved. On a daily basis, we recognize revenue under contracts that provide for specific time, material and equipment charges, which we bill periodically, ranging from weekly to monthly.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We account for significant fixed-price contracts, which we enter into mainly in our Subsea Products segment, and to a lesser extent in our Subsea Projects and Advanced Technologies segments, using the percentage-of-completion method. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we accounted for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our revenue using the percentage-of-completion method. In determining whether a contract should be accounted for using the percentage-of-completion method, we consider whether:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the customer provides specifications for the construction of facilities or production of goods or for the provision of related services;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	we can reasonably estimate our progress towards completion and our costs;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the contract includes provisions as to the enforceable rights regarding the goods or services to be provided, consideration to be received and the manner and terms of payment;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the customer can be expected to satisfy its obligations under the contract; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	we can be expected to perform our contractual obligations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Under the percentage-of-completion method, we generally recognize estimated contract revenue based on costs incurred to date as a percentage of total estimated costs. Changes in the expected cost of materials and labor, productivity, scheduling and other factors affect the total estimated costs. Additionally, external factors, including weather or other factors outside of our control, may also affect the progress and estimated cost of a project's completion and, therefore, the timing of income and revenue recognition. We routinely review estimates related to our contracts and reflect revisions to profitability in earnings immediately. If a current estimate of total contract cost indicates an ultimate loss on a contract, we recognize the projected loss in full when we determine it. In prior years, we have recorded adjustments to earnings as a result of revisions to contract estimates. Although we are continually striving to accurately estimate our contract costs and profitability, adjustments to overall contract costs could be significant in future periods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We recognize the remainder of our revenue when persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery has occurred or services have been rendered, price is fixed or determinable and collection is reasonably assured.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	29
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;" HREF="#OII_10KX12312016_HTM_S89F67D9B094FBFCD9CA6ACFB121B28B3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Property and Equipment and Long-lived Intangible Assets.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;We periodically and upon the occurrence of a triggering event review the realizability of our property and equipment and long-lived intangible assets to determine whether any events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable. For long-lived assets to be held and used, we base our evaluation on impairment indicators such as the nature of the assets, the future economic benefits of the assets, any historical or future profitability measurements and other external market conditions or factors that may be present. If such impairment indicators are present or other factors exist that indicate that the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable, we determine whether an impairment has occurred through the use of an undiscounted cash flows analysis of the asset at the lowest level for which identifiable cash flows exist. If an impairment has occurred, we recognize a loss for the difference between the carrying amount and the fair value of the asset. For assets held for sale or disposal, the fair value of the asset is measured using fair market value less cost to sell. Assets are classified as held-for-sale when we have a plan for disposal of certain assets and those assets meet the held for sale criteria.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We charge the costs of repair and maintenance of property and equipment to operations as incurred, while we capitalize the costs of improvements that extend asset lives or functionality.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Goodwill.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In our annual evaluation of goodwill for impairment, we first assess qualitative factors to determine whether the existence of events or circumstances leads to a determination that it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit is less than its carrying amount. If, after assessing the totality of events or circumstances, we determine it is more likely than not that the fair value of a reporting unit exceeds its carrying amount, performing the two-step impairment test is unnecessary. However, if we conclude otherwise, then we are required to perform the first step of the two-step impairment test. We estimate fair value of the reporting units using both an income approach, which considers a discounted cash flow model, and a market approach. Reductions in estimates of our future cash flows or adverse changes in market comparable information may result in goodwill impairments in the future.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For reporting units with goodwill, we do not believe our goodwill will be impaired during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Income Taxes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our tax provisions are based on our expected taxable income, statutory rates and tax-planning opportunities available to us in the various jurisdictions in which we operate. Determination of taxable income in any jurisdiction requires the interpretation of the related tax laws. We are at risk that a taxing authority's final determination of our tax liabilities may differ from our interpretation. Our effective tax rate may fluctuate from year to year as our operations are conducted in different taxing jurisdictions, the amount of pre-tax income fluctuates, the amounts of foreign income we anticipate will be repatriated and our estimates regarding the realizability of items such as foreign tax credits may change. We consider
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$623 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of unremitted earnings of our foreign subsidiaries to be indefinitely reinvested. We believe we have the ability to indefinitely reinvest these foreign earnings based on our expectations of profitability for our U.S. operations over the long term, our significant U.S. liquidity, and the amount of unremitted earnings of our foreign subsidiaries not considered indefinitely reinvested, for which we have provided deferred income taxes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We account for any applicable interest and penalties on uncertain tax positions as a component of our provision for income taxes on our financial statements. Current income tax expense represents either nonresident withholding taxes or the liabilities expected to be reflected on our income tax returns for the current year, while the net deferred income tax expense or benefit represents the change in the balance of deferred tax assets or liabilities as reported on our balance sheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We establish valuation allowances to reduce deferred tax assets when it is more likely than not that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized in the future. While we have considered estimated future taxable income and ongoing prudent and feasible tax-planning strategies in assessing the need for the valuation allowances, changes in these estimates and assumptions, as well as changes in tax laws, could require us to provide for valuation allowances for our deferred tax assets. Provisions for valuation allowances impact our income tax provision in the period in which such adjustments are identified and recorded. We established a deferred tax asset valuation allowance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in 2016 related to the realizability of loss carryforwards in certain of our foreign jurisdictions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;" HREF="#OII_10KX12312016_HTM_S89F67D9B094FBFCD9CA6ACFB121B28B3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In March 2016, the FASB issued ASU 2016-09, "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Compensation &#8211; Stock Compensation Improvements to Employee Share-Based Payment Accounting
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	." This update requires that all excess tax benefits and tax deficiencies (including tax benefits of dividends on share-based payment awards) should be recognized as income tax expense or benefit in the income statement. The tax effects of exercised or vested awards should be treated as discrete items in the reporting period in which they occur. An entity also should recognize excess tax benefits regardless of whether the benefit reduces taxes payable in the current period. Currently, an entity must determine, for each award, whether the difference between the deduction for tax purposes and the compensation cost recognized for financial reporting purposes results in either an excess tax benefit or a tax deficiency. The amendments in this update are effective for us beginning January 1, 2017. Through December&#160;31,&#160;2016, we recognized excess tax benefits in additional paid-in capital, and tax deficiencies have been recognized as an offset to accumulated excess tax benefits. In 2017, we expect a tax deficiency in the first quarter and, under this new standard, we will recognize it as a discrete item in the income statement rather than in additional paid-in capital. We do not anticipate that this update will have a material effect on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For a summary of our major accounting policies and a discussion of recently adopted accounting standards, please see Note&#160;1 to our Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We consider our liquidity and capital resources adequate to support our operations and growth initiatives. At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we had working capital of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$754 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, including cash and cash equivalents of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$450 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. Additionally, we had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;available through our revolving credit facility under a credit agreement (as amended, the "Credit Agreement"), which is scheduled to expire on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	October&#160;25, 2021
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In October 2014, we entered into the Credit Agreement with a group of banks to replace our prior principal credit agreement. The Credit Agreement provides for a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$300 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;three-year term loan (the "Term Loan Facility") and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;five-year revolving credit facility (the "Revolving Credit Facility"). Subject to certain conditions, the aggregate commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility may be increased to up to $800 million at any time upon agreement between us and existing or additional lenders. Borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility and the Term Loan Facility may be used for general corporate purposes. Simultaneously with the execution of the Credit Agreement and pursuant to its terms, we repaid all amounts outstanding under, and terminated, the prior credit agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November&#160;2015, we entered into an Agreement and Amendment No. 1 to Credit Agreement ("Amendment No. 1"). Amendment No. 1 amended the Credit Agreement to (1) replace the maximum leverage ratio financial covenant with a new financial covenant restricting the maximum total capitalization ratio (defined in Amendment No. 1 to be the ratio of consolidated debt to total capitalization) to 55% and (2) extend the maturities of the Term Loan Facility and the Revolving Credit Facility by one year each, which maturity terms have since been superseded by amendment, as described below.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November 2016, we entered into Agreement and Amendment No. 2 to Credit Agreement ("Amendment No. 2"). Amendment No. 2 amended the Credit Agreement to, among other things, extend the maturities of the Term Loan Facility and the Revolving Credit Facility to October&#160;25,&#160;2019 and October 25, 2021, respectively, with the extending Lenders, which represent 90% of the existing commitments of the Lenders, such that (a) the total commitments for the Revolving Credit Facility will be $500&#160;million until October&#160;25,&#160;2020 and thereafter $450&#160;million until October 25, 2021, and (b) the outstanding term loan maturities pursuant to the Term Loan Facility will be $300&#160;million until October 27, 2018 and thereafter $270&#160;million until October 25, 2019.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Borrowings under the Credit Agreement bear interest at an Adjusted Base Rate or the Eurodollar Rate (both as defined in the Credit Agreement), at our option, plus an applicable margin initially based on our Leverage Ratio (as defined in the Credit Agreement) and, at our election, based on ratings of our senior unsecured debt by designated ratings services, thereafter to be based on such debt ratings. The applicable margin varies: (1) in the case of advances bearing interest at the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	31
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;" HREF="#OII_10KX12312016_HTM_S89F67D9B094FBFCD9CA6ACFB121B28B3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Adjusted Base Rate, from 0.125% to 0.750% for borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility and from 0% to 0.500% for borrowings under the Term Loan Facility; and (2) in the case of advances bearing interest at the Eurodollar Rate, from 1.125% to 1.750% for borrowings under the Revolving Credit Facility and from 1.000% to 1.500% for borrowings under the Term Loan Facility. The Adjusted Base Rate is the highest of (1) the per annum rate established by the administrative agent as its prime rate, (2) the federal funds rate plus 0.50% and (3) the daily one-month LIBOR plus 1%. We pay a commitment fee ranging from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.125%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	0.300%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;on the unused portion of the Revolving Credit Facility, depending on our Leverage Ratio. The commitment fees are included as interest expense in our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Credit Agreement contains various covenants that we believe are customary for agreements of this nature, including, but not limited to, restrictions on our ability and the ability of each of our subsidiaries to incur debt, grant liens, make certain investments, make distributions, merge or consolidate, sell assets, enter into transactions with affiliates and enter into certain restrictive agreements. We are also subject to a maximum total capitalization ratio of 55%, as noted above. The Credit Agreement includes customary events of default and associated remedies. As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we were in compliance with all the covenants set forth in the Credit Agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November&#160;2014, we completed the public offering of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;aggregate principal amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.650%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Senior Notes due 2024 (the "Senior Notes"). We pay interest on the Senior Notes on May&#160;15 and November 15 of each year, beginning on May 15, 2015. The Senior Notes are scheduled to mature on November 15, 2024. We may redeem some or all of the Senior Notes prior to maturity at specified redemption prices. We used the net proceeds from the offering for general corporate purposes, including funding the acquisition described below, other capital expenditures and repurchases of shares of our common stock.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;under the Credit Agreement and Senior Notes was $800 million, and our total interest costs, including commitment fees, were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$29.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	$143 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$424 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$427 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Our capital expenditures in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$50 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our ROV segment,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$57 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Products segment and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$26 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Projects segment. Our capital expenditures in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;included our acquisition of C &amp; C Technologies, Inc. ("C&amp;C") for approximately $224 million. C&amp;C is a global provider of ocean-bottom mapping services in deepwater utilizing customized autonomous underwater vehicles and provides marine construction surveys for both surface and subsea assets, as well as satellite-based positioning services for drilling rigs and seismic and construction vessels. C&amp;C also provides land and near-shore survey services along the U.S. Gulf Coast and in Mexico, and performs shallow water conventional geophysical surveys in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico. In addition to the C&amp;C acquisition, our capital expenditures in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;included:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$58 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for upgrading and expanding our ROV fleet;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$69 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Products segment, principally for growth of our tooling and installation and workover control systems capabilities; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$52 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Projects segment, including $43 million related to a new subsea support vessel scheduled for delivery in 2017. Our capital expenditures in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;included:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$189 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;for upgrading and expanding our ROV fleet;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$113 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Products segment, principally for growth of our tooling and installation and workover control systems capabilities, expansion of our Houston manufacturing facilities and establishment of manufacturing capabilities in Angola; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$92 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Projects segment, including $40 million related to a new subsea support vessel scheduled for delivery in 2017.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we expect our capital expenditures to be in the range of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$90 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$120 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, exclusive of business acquisitions. This estimate includes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$25 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in our Subsea Projects segment to complete the new-build subsea support vessel, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ocean Evolution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, scheduled for delivery in the middle of 2017. During the third quarter of 2013, we signed an agreement with a shipyard for the construction of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ocean Evolution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We intend for the vessel to be U.S.-flagged and documented with a coastwise endorsement by the U.S. Coast Guard. It is expected to have an overall length of 353 feet, a Class 2 dynamic positioning system, accommodations for 110 personnel, a helideck, a 250-ton active heave-compensated crane, and a working moonpool. We expect to outfit the vessel with two of our high specification work-class ROVs. The vessel will also be equipped
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	32

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	with a satellite communications system capable of transmitting streaming video for real-time work observation by shore personnel. We anticipate the vessel will be used to augment our ability to provide subsea intervention services in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico. These services are required to perform inspection, maintenance and repair projects and hardware installations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Unless indicated otherwise, each of the vessels discussed below is a deepwater multiservice subsea support vessel outfitted with two of our high-specification work-class ROVs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Beginning in the third quarter of 2008, we chartered a vessel, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Olympic&#160;Intervention&#160;IV
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, for an initial term of five years. Following extension periods, the charter expired in July 2016, and we released the vessel to its owner. We had been using the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Olympic&#160;Intervention&#160;IV
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In 2012, we moved the chartered vessel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ocean&#160;Intervention&#160;III
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	to Angola and also chartered the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bourbon&#160;Oceanteam 101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to work on a three-year field support vessel services contract for a unit of BP plc. We had extended the charter of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bourbon&#160;Oceanteam&#160;101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	to January 2017. However, in early 2016, the customer exercised its right,&#160;under the field&#160;support vessel services contract, to terminate its use of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Bourbon&#160;Oceanteam&#160;101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at the end of May&#160;2016. Under the terms of the contract, the costs incurred by us associated with the early release and demobilization of the vessel were reimbursed by the customer. Following the release of the vessel, we redelivered it to the vessel supplier. Under the field support vessel services contract, which has been extended through January&#160;2019, we are continuing to supply project management, engineering and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ocean&#160;Intervention&#160;III
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which we have under charter on a month-to-month basis through July 2017. We also provide ROV tooling, asset integrity services and installation and workover control system services. We also have provided other chartered vessels and barges as requested by the customer.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In March&#160;2013, we commenced a five-year charter for a Jones Act-compliant multi-service support vessel, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ocean Alliance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we have been using in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico. In January&#160;2015, we commenced a two-year contract with a customer for the use of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Ocean Alliance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The contract expired in January 2017, and we are marketing the vessel for spot market work in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In December&#160;2013, we commenced a three-year charter for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Normand Flower,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a multi-service subsea marine support vessel. We made modifications to the vessel and used the vessel in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico to perform inspection, maintenance and repair projects and hardware installations. In December&#160;2016, we declined our option to extend the charter and the vessel was released.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In November&#160;2015, we commenced a two-year charter for the use of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Island Pride,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	a multi-service subsea marine support vessel. We are using the vessel under a two-year contract to provide field support services off the coast of India for an oil and gas customer based in India. We have options to extend the charter for up to two additional years.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We also charter or lease vessels on a short-term basis as necessary to augment our fleet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,

	&#32;and

	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;" HREF="#OII_10KX12312016_HTM_S89F67D9B094FBFCD9CA6ACFB121B28B3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>

</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	accrued liabilities. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our accounts receivable, inventory and accounts payable and accrued liabilities all decreased as a result of lower revenue and activity in general from each year's preceding year. The 2016 and 2015 decreases in inventory were in addition to write-downs totaling
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$30 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$26 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, in our ROV and Subsea Products segments discussed below. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, our inventory decreased as a result of the use of inventory in progressing and completing projects that had been in our Subsea Products backlog at December&#160;31,&#160;2013 and our expectation of lower Subsea Products demand in 2015 as compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we used a net of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$169 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in investing activities, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$143 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;used to fund the capital expenditures described above and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$39 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;used to purchase Angolan central bank bonds indexed to the U.S. dollar. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we used a net of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$437 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in investing activities, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$424 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;used to fund the capital expenditures and business acquisitions described above. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we used a net of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$419 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in investing activities, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$427 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;used to fund the capital expenditures and business acquisitions described above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we used
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$97 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in financing activities, primarily for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$94 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of cash dividends we paid. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we used
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$157 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in financing activities. We borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$50 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and paid cash dividends of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$106 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we generated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$45 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in financing activities. We borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$742 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, net of associated expenses and debt discount, repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$590 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and paid cash dividends of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$110 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In February 2010, our Board of Directors approved a program to repurchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock. In 2014, we completed the purchase of the shares authorized under that program by repurchasing the remaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	8.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$590 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The total cost for the repurchase of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$677 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In December 2014, following completion of the February 2010 program, our Board of Directors approved a new share repurchase program under which we may repurchase up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock on a discretionary basis. The December 2014 program calls for the repurchases to be made in the open market, or in privately negotiated transactions from time to time, in compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, including Rule 10b-18 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, subject to market and business conditions, levels of available liquidity, cash requirements for other purposes, applicable legal requirements and other relevant factors. The timing and amount of any repurchases will be determined by our management based on its evaluation of these factors. We expect that any shares repurchased under the new program will be held as treasury stock for future possible use. The new program does not obligate us to repurchase any particular number of shares. Through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;under the new program, we repurchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our common stock for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We did not repurchase any shares in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, we retained
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the shares we had repurchased. We expect to hold the shares repurchased for future use.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Because of our significant foreign operations, we are exposed to currency fluctuations and exchange rate risks. We generally minimize these risks primarily through matching, to the extent possible, revenue and expense in the various currencies in which we operate. Cumulative translation adjustments as of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;relate primarily to our net investments in, including long-term loans to, our foreign subsidiaries. A stronger U.S. dollar against the U.K. pound sterling, Norwegian kroner and Brazilian real would result in lower operating income. See Item&#160;7A &#8211; "Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk."
</FONT>
</DIV>

<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:18PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Results of Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:6PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additional information on our business segments is shown in Note 7 of the Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements included in this report.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Oilfield.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;The table that follows sets out revenue and profitability for the business segments within our Oilfield business. In the ROV section of the table that follows, "Days available" includes all days from the first day that an ROV is placed in service until the ROV is retired. All days in this period are considered available days, including periods when an ROV is undergoing maintenance or repairs. Our ROVs do not have scheduled maintenance or repair that requires significant time when the ROVs are not available for utilization.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<TD COLSPAN="3" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

	&#160;

<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<A STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;" HREF="#OII_10KX12312016_HTM_S89F67D9B094FBFCD9CA6ACFB121B28B3">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-TOP:12PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Historically, we built new ROVs to increase the size of our fleet in response to demand to support deepwater drilling and vessel-based inspection, maintenance and repair ("IMR") and installation work. In 2015, as a result of declining market conditions, we began building fewer ROVs, primarily to meet contractual commitments. These vehicles are designed for use around the world in water depths of 10,000 feet or more. We added
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	49
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;ROVs in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively, while retiring
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	94
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;units over the three-year period and transferring
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to our Advanced Technologies segment over that period. Our ROV fleet size was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	280
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	315
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	336
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. We have decreased our ROV fleet size over the last two years as a result of lower market demand.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Our ROV operating income decreased in the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	December&#160;31, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;compared to the prior year, as a result of lower days on hire and lower average revenue per day-on-hire, as well as inventory write-downs and fixed asset write-offs totaling $36.0 million in 2016. During 2016, the leading indicator for deepwater activity, contracted floating rigs, continued to decline as the rate of rigs being idled, either by contract termination or expiration, continued. This prevailing market condition required us to reassess the number of ROVs we had in our fleet, as well as the associated inventory. As a result of our reassessment, in 2016 we recorded $36.0 million of charges consisting of: (1) $25.2 million for a reserve for excess inventory; and (2) $10.8 million for the retirement of 39 ROVs. During 2016 we also incurred charges related to restructuring expenses of $3.8&#160;million and bad debt expenses of $1.2&#160;million.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	For 2015, our ROV revenue and operating income declined from 2014 from lower demand for drill support services and a reduction in average revenue per day across all our geographic areas of operation. ROV days on hire decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and revenue per day on hire decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	11%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. In 2015, our ROV cost of services and products included inventory write-downs of $15.7&#160;million, restructuring expenses of $7.2&#160;million and ROV retirements resulting in write-offs of $2.9&#160;million. The inventory write downs were due to excess inventory, which we do not anticipate using given current and forecast market conditions. The restructuring expenses related to severance costs for incurred and designated future workforce reductions and costs associated with closing excess facilities. The write-offs were necessitated as a result of our retiring an unusually large number of ROVs in 2015 due to market prospects for these vehicles.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In our financial statements, the charges incurred in both 2016 and 2015 are reflected in our cost of services and products, except for the charges related to bad debts, which are reflected in general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	We anticipate ROV operating income to decrease in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as a result of decreases in average revenue per day on hire and the number of days on hire for drilling support services, attributable to the market conditions described under "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Overview
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	" above. We normally expect to retire, on average,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of our fleet on an annual basis, although we retired a greater number in each of 2016 and 2015 due to market conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	To improve operational efficiency, in 2016 we reorganized our Subsea Products segment into two business units &#8211; (1) manufactured products and (2) service and rental. Manufactured products include production control umbilicals and specialty subsea hardware, while service and rental includes tooling, subsea work systems and installation and workover control systems. This internal reorganization does not affect our segment reporting structure or the historical comparability of our segment results. The following table presents revenue from manufactured products and service and rental, as their respective percentages of total Subsea Products revenue:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;HEIGHT:20PX;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

</FONT>

	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:VERDANA,SANS-SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Service and Rental
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;

</DIV>
